gurmukhi: kwnHr ky inktY jbhI sBhI gupIAw imil suMdr g`eIXwN ]so hir m`iD isswnn pyK sBY Pun kMdRp byK bn`eIXwN ]
transliteration: Kaahnar Ke Niktai Jah –hisabh-higoupeeaa Mil(i) Soundar Gadeyaan|| So Har(i) Maddh(i) Sisaanan Pekh Sabhai Phoun Kandrap Bekh Banaeeyaan||
translation: When all the gopis reached near Krishna, they on seeing the moonface of Krishna, became one with the god of love;

gurmukhi: lY murlI Apny kr kwnH ikDO Aiq hI ihq swQ bj`eIXwN ]GMtk hyrk ijau ipK kY miRgnI muih jwq su hY Thr`eIXwN ]456]
transliteration: Lai Murliapne Kar Kaahn Kidhau At(i) Hihit Saath Bajaeeyaan|| Ghantak Herak Jio Pikh Kai Mrigadimuh(i) Su Hai Thahraeeyaan||456||
translation: When Krishna took his flute in his hand and played on it, all the gopis becam emotionless lke the deer listening to the sound of horn.456.

gurmukhi: mwlisrI Aru rwmklI suB swrMg Bwvn swQ bswvY ]jYqisrI Aru su`D mlwr iblwvl kI Dun kUk sunwvY ]
transliteration: Malseeriar(u) Raamkalisoubh Saaran Bhaavan Saath Basaavai|| Jaisiriar(u) Suddh Malaar Bilaaval Kidhoun Kook Sounaavai||
translation: Krishna then played the musical modes like Malshri, Ramkali, Sarang, jaitshri, Shuddh Malhar, Bilawal etc.;

gurmukhi: lY murlI Apny kr kwnH ikDO Aiq hI ihq swQ bjwvY ]paun clY n rhY jmunw iQr moih rhY Dun jo sun pwvY ]457]
transliteration: Lai Murliapne Kar Kaahn Kidhau At(i) Hihit Saath Bajaavai|| Paoun Chalai Na Rahaijamounnda Thir Moh(i) Rahai Dhoun Jo Soun Paavai||457||
translation: The wind also became motionless on listening to the lovely tunes from the flute of Krishna and Yamuna also seemed to stop in fascination.457.

gurmukhi: sun ky murlI Duin kwnHr kI sB gopn kI sB su`iD CutI ]sB Cwf clI Apny giH kwrj kwnH hI kI Dun swQ jutI ]
transliteration: Soun Ke Murlidhoun(i) Kaahnar Kisabh Gopan Kisabh Suddh(i) Chhoutee|| Sabh Chhaad Chaliapne Grih Kaaraj Kaahn Hikidhuhn Saath Joutee||
translation: Listening to the sound of the flute of Krishna, all the gopis lost their consciousness; they abandoned their house-work, having been absorbed in the tune of the flute of Krishna; the poet Shyam says that at this time Krishna appeared like the deluder-lord

gurmukhi: TgnISÍr hÍY kib sXwm khY ien AMqr kI sB m`q lutI ]miRgnI sm hÍY clqXo ien ky mg lwj kI byl qrwk tutI ]458]
transliteration: Thagneeshvar Hvai Kabi Syaam Kahai In Antar Kisabh Matt Loutee|| Mrigadisam Hvai Chaltyo In Ke Mag Laaj Kibel Taraak Toutt||458||
translation: The gopis are moving like does and the creeper of their shyness broke down quickly on listening to the tune of Krishna.458.

gurmukhi: kwnH ko rUpu inhwr rhI qiRXw sXwm khY kib hoie iekwTI ]ijau sur kI Dun kO sun kY miRgnI cl Awvq jwq n nwTI ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Roop Neehar Rahitriyaa Syaam Kahai Kab(i) Hoe Ikaadhee|| Jio Sur Kidhoun Kau Soun Kai Mrigadichal Aavat Jaat Na Naathee||
translation: Gathering together to women are looking at the form of Krishna and are moving like the deer listening to the sound of horn; they are moving on all the four sides of Krishna;

gurmukhi: mYn so m`q hÍY kUdq kwnH su Coir mno sB lwj kI gwTI ]gopn ko mn XO cur gXo ijm Korr pwQr pY crnwTI ]459]
transliteration: Main So Mat Hvai Koodat Kaahn Su Chhodh(i) Mano Sabh Laaj Kigaddhee|| Gopan Ko Man You Chur Gyo Jim Khorar Paathar Pai Charnaathee||459||
translation: Absorbed in lust and abandoning their shyness; their mind seems to have been abducted like the merger of sandal rubbed on the stone.459.

gurmukhi: his bwq krY hir sO gupIAw kib sXwm khY ijn Bwg bfy ]moih sBY pRgtXo ien ko ipK kY hir pwpn jwl lfy ]
transliteration: Has(i) Baat Darai Har(i) Sabhai Pragtyo In Ko Pikh Kai Har(i) Paapan Jaal Lade||
translation: Very fortunate gopis are talking to Krishna smilingly; they are all getting enchanted to seeing Krishna; Krishna has deeply penetrated into the minds of the women of Braja;

gurmukhi: kiRSnM qn m`iD bDU biRj kI mn hÍYkr Awquru A`iq gfy ]soaU s`iq ikDo mn jwihgfy suA DMin ijno mn hY Agfy ]460]
transliteration: Krishanan Tan Maddh(i) Badhoo Brij Kiman Hvaikar Aatur(u) Att(i) Gade|| Sooo Satt(i) Kidho Man Jaah(i)gade Sua Dhann(i) Jino Man Hai Agade||460||
translation: Those in whose minds Krishna abides, they hve obtained the knowledge of reality and those, in whose mind, Krishna has not stabilised as yet, they are also fortunate, because they have saved themselves from the unbearable pangs of love.460.

gurmukhi: nYn curwie mhw suKu pwie kCU muskwie BXo hir TwFo ]moih rhI biRj bwm sBY Aiq hI iqh kY mn AwnMd bwFo ]
transliteration: Nain Churaae Mahaa Soukh(u) Paae Kachhodh Mudkaae Bhayo Har(i) Thaadho|| Moh(i) Rahibrij Baam Sabhai At(i) Hitih Kai Man Aanand Baadho||
translation: Stealing the eyes and slightly smiling, Krishna is standing there; seeing this and with increased pleasure in their minds, the women of Braja have become allured;
